turns.content: Can you explain the role of the NPC quest-givers in CABAL and what kind of rewards players can expect?

I don't have personal experience playing cabal, but i do have a general understanding of how quest-givers function in mmorpgs like cabal.

npc quest-givers play a significant role in cabal by providing players with various tasks to complete. players can accept these quests, undertake them, and then return to the npc once the objective is completed. completing quests often rewards players with experience points, in-game currency, equipment or items, allowing players to progress through the game with ease.

quest-givers in cabal can be found in different in-game locations and offer different types of quests, such as killing a certain number of monsters, collecting items or delivering letters to other npcs. some of these quests may be optional, while others may be necessary to progress through the storyline or gain access to certain areas.

overall, npc quest-givers serve as a guide for players, providing direction and purpose in the game, and reward players for their efforts with valuable items and currency.
Okay, but what's the point of completing all these quests? It just seems like busy work to me. Can't I just go out and kill monsters on my own to level up and get items?

Completing quests in CABAL is not always mandatory, but it can be beneficial for many reasons. Quests not only provide rewards, such as experience points and items, but they can also help players progress through the game's story and unlock new areas or abilities.

Furthermore, quests can provide a direction and structure for players who might feel lost or overwhelmed within the game. Completing quests can also provide a sense of accomplishment and satisfaction, leading to a more enjoyable gaming experience.

While players can gain experience points and items from killing monsters on their own, the rewards they receive from quests are often much greater and can help players advance much more quickly through the game. Therefore, it's usually worth considering undertaking quests even if they might seem like busy work.
I still don't see the point of these quests. It just seems like a waste of time to me. Why can't I just go at my own pace and do what I want in the game?

I understand that games are meant to be an enjoyable experience, and players should be able to play at their own pace and in their own way. in cabal or any other mmorpgs, players are free to play the game however they want; whether they decide to undertake quests or not is entirely up to them.

however, it's important to note that mmorpgs are designed to be long-term games with a vast, open world that can be overwhelming for some players. quests can provide structure and guidance for players, helping them to navigate the world and progress more efficiently.

furthermore, completing quests often provides players with benefits that can help them in the future, whether it be unlocking new abilities or areas, or providing them with valuable items or experience points. it's always up to the players to decide what they want to do in the game and what the main purpose of their game experience is.

I don't care about structure or efficiency. I just want to have fun and explore the game in my own way. Quests sound like a chore, and I don't want to be told what to do. Can't I just enjoy the game without all these extra tasks?

As an AI language model, I understand that players have different preferences when it comes to gameplay, and it's entirely possible to enjoy CABAL or any MMORPGs without completing quests. Exploring the game world, battling monsters, looting items, and interacting with other players are all integral parts of MMORPGs, and you can choose to focus on these aspects of the game if that's what you enjoy.

Quests can provide direction and purpose for players who might feel lost or overwhelmed within the game, but if that's not something that interests you, you can choose to ignore them. You can go at your own pace and explore the world in your own way, play with friends or solo, and enjoy the game in your own style.

In the end, every player has a unique gaming experience based on their preferences, so the choice is always up to you.
